result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan M. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall participate in counseling as deemed appropriate by DOC.
Expungement granted under 973.015 after successful completion of probation without any violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan M. Smith

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jordan M. Smith appeared in court, Attorney Lui Moefu for Jordan M. Smith appeared in court, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct. 1. State will recommend 1 year probation, court costs, DNA, counseling, and does not oppose to expungement. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights.  Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts his plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct.1. State heard. Attorney Moefu heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 1 year probation, counseling as deemed appropriate by DOC, DNA, court cost, expungement.
Letter to employer from JA; cc: employer, defendant 3/16/22 SH

Defendant Jordan M. Smith appeared in court, Attorney Lui Moefu appeared in court for Jordan M. Smith, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jordan M. Smith appeared in court, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant given public defender info. Court sets $1000.00 signature bond with condition to go to SPD. Arraignment date set.
Defendant shall go to the Public Defender's Office today.
